title: Leapfrog the cat loves to jump over obstacles - from stacks of cushions to her family's dog
text:
From a stack of pumpkins to an enormous inflatable snowman, no obstacle is too high for this cat to jump over.

Six-year-old Leapfrog wows an army of social media fans by hurdling whatever stands in her way.

In a hilarious compilation video, owner Jeanine Jackson, from Portland, Oregon, has filmed her pet bounding over a range of quirky jumps - including bowls of apples and a meditating woman.

Leapfrog the cat jumps over Kimberly Cobrain who is meditating at the house in Portland, Oregon

Six-year-old Leapfrog (left) is owned by Jeanine Jackson (right) who said her pet has been jumping since she was a kitten

It shows the black puss clearing a tower of cushions, a pile of toilet rolls and even another cat with ease.

In fact any object which impedes Leapfrog's path from the corner of the kitchen is vaulted.

Ms Jackson said: 'She's been leaping since she was a kitten, as if she was raised by goats.

'She does not like the kitchen floor for some reason, and leaps over it every time.

Whatever you put in her way, she will jump over it, whether that's a table, a chair or even a person.'

Leapfrog hurdles anything which blocks her path in the corner of the kitchen, be it a bowl of fruit (left) or a pile of bottles

To prove how confident she is in the springy cat's jumping abilities, Ms Jackson perched some glass and china ornaments on top of a stool.

Leaping high into the air, the feline easily clears the fragile objects by at least a foot.

Leapfrog also tackles human barriers, including Ms Jackson's meditating cousin Kimberly Cobrain and another cousin Cheryl Hummon, who crouches down with cuddly toys on her back.

The springy cat jumps over a dog, who does not even realise until she has landed
description: Pet owner Jeanine Jackson, from Portland, Oregon, filmed her six-year-old cat bounding over a range of quirky obstacles - including bowls of apples and a meditating woman.
